definition: to exceed/to go beyond/to transcend/to cross over/to jump over
generic word for peoples or states of south China or south Asia at different historical periods/abbr. for Vietnam 越南
to exceed/to climb over/to surpass/the more... the more
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: And his parents went every year to Jerusalem, at the solemn day of the pasch.
sentences.chinese: 他的父母每年逾越节往耶路撒冷去。

sentences.english: In the eighteenth year of the reign of Josiah was this passover kept.
sentences.chinese: 这逾越节是约西亚作王十八年守的。

sentences.english: They are to eat the lamb, together with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
sentences.chinese: 他们也要用无酵饼和苦菜与逾越节的羊羔同吃。

sentences.english: This Passover was celebrated in the eighteenth year of Josiah's reign.
sentences.chinese: 这逾越节是约西亚作王十八年守的。

sentences.english: But in the eighteenth year of King Josiah, this Passover was celebrated to the Lord in Jerusalem.
sentences.chinese: 只有约西亚王十八年在耶路撒冷向耶和华守这逾越节。

sentences.english: Let the children of Israel also keep the passover at his appointed season.
sentences.chinese: 以色列人应当在所定的日期守逾越节。

sentences.english: And in the fourteenth day of the first month is the passover of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 正月十四日是耶和华的逾越节。

sentences.english: He witnessed the impressive rites of the paschal service.
sentences.chinese: 他看到逾越节崇祀中一切动人心弦的仪式。

sentences.english: The people had to make a choice on the night of the Passover.
sentences.chinese: 以色列民要在逾越节的晚上作出抉择。

sentences.english: And the children of the captivity kept the passover upon the fourteenth day of the first month.
sentences.chinese: 正月十四日，被掳归回的人守逾越节。

sentences.english: And the children of Israel of the captivity kept the phase, on the fourteenth day of the first month.
sentences.chinese: 由充军归来的子民，于正月十四日，举行了逾越节。

sentences.english: The unleavened cakes at the Passover season are before Him.
sentences.chinese: 逾越节用的无酵饼就在他面前。

sentences.english: Jews traditionally observe Passover with a feast known as a Seder.
sentences.chinese: 犹太人过以逾越节家宴来庆祝逾越节。

sentences.english: Jews traditionally observe Passover with a feast known as a Seder.
sentences.chinese: 犹太人过以逾越节家宴来庆祝逾越节。

sentences.english: It was Passover week when Nicodemus came to talk with Christ.
sentences.chinese: 尼哥底母是在逾越节期间来找基督。
那时犹太人的逾越节近了。

definition: Yom Kippur or Day of Atonement (Jewish holiday)
Book of Leviticus/Third Book of Moses
Book of Deuteronomy/Fifth Book of Moses
Nisan, the first month of the ecclesiastical year in the Jewish calendar
Lent (Christian period of forty days before Easter)
tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
